revenue.notes: Record quarterly revenue led by Data Center and Blackwell demand

gross_margin.notes: Includes adjustments for stock-based compensation and acquisition costs

highlights: Blackwell revenue topped $11B in its first quarter with fastest ramp in company history
Data Center revenue now $115.2B for FY 2025, more than doubling year over year
Inference and reasoning models (OpenAI, DeepSeek-R1, Grok 3) continue to drive capacity build-outs
New GeForce RTX 50-series and DLSS 4 launched alongside Copilot+ AI PC partnerships
Supply constraints eased slightly with expectation of Q1 sequential rebound
Digital twin, robotics, and simulation workloads benefit from Omniverse and AI Blueprints
Record Automotive revenue as Toyota, Aurora, Continental, and Hyundai ramp Orin and Drive platforms

from_operations.notes: GAAP cash from ops reflects strong revenue and deferred investment timing

free_cash_flow.notes: After CapEx and PP&E purchases the quarter remained highly cash generative

cash_paid_PP&E.notes: Investments continue to support Blackwell and data center build-outs

non_gaap_investments.notes: Acquisitions and non-affiliated investments to expand AI software and services

data_center_and_blackwell: Blackwell became available across AWS, Azure, GCP, OCI, and sovereign builds with 100k+ GPU clusters
Q4 Data Center revenue grew 18% sequentially with GB200 deployments used for training, inference, and reasoning workloads
inference_and_scaling: Blackwell designed for reasoning AI delivers 25x faster throughput and 20x lower cost vs Hopper for long-thinking workloads
Inference time scaling (Strawberry, Grok 3, DeepSeek-R1) is consuming 100x more compute and is already expanding rapidly
networking: Spectrum-X Ethernet and NVLink switches power AI factories while networking revenue expected to rebound in Q1 after a slight sequential dip
Cisco and other partners embedding Spectrum-X to extend GPU-accelerated networking across enterprise AI deployments
gaming_and_ai_pcs: GeForce RTX 50 series PCs deliver up to 2x generational performance and multi-frame generation through DLSS 4
Copilot+ PCs launched with multi-modal AI experiences while gaming supply constraints ease going into Q1
sovereign_and_physical_ai: Sovereign clouds, including the $500B Stargate project, adopt GB200 clusters and Omniverse/AI Blueprints
Automotive and robotics wins (Toyota, Hyundai, Uber, Aurora) expand the physical AI platform and DriveOS certification

q1_guidance.other_income: ≈0.4 billion USD income excluding non-marketable investment volatility

full_year_fy26.revenue_growth: Double-digit growth sustained by AI and Data Center investments
full_year_fy26.capex: >30 billion USD with finance-lease timing, with more short-lived assets supporting cloud expansions
full_year_fy26.operating_expenses: Expected to grow into the mid-30s percentile year over year as R&D and data center spend continue
full_year_fy26.gross_margin_direction: Low-70s this quarter, improving toward mid-70s as Blackwell yields normalize

metadata.source: NVIDIA FY2025 Q4 earnings release and transcript
